column4: hello... i am having a weird problem trying to install ubuntu
i have tried 11.10, 11.04, 12.04... both the livecd and the alt install cd
did u look at my screenshot?
is it possible to change the boot options on the iso before i burn it? b/c i cant pass any arguments to the boot while it's booting
IntuitiveNipple: it is garbled as soon as my bios screen is gone
yes, I think there is a way to change it, lived CD use ISOlinux bootloader to load, just edit the file settings.
I found a way for you
try to edit isolinux config, open livedCD image, isolinux folder, edit the file txt.cfg as advised on the Internet or IntuitiveNipple's link.
the file txt.cfg contains what you need to edit.
if possible, try the old ones, like 6.06, 7.04, 8.04 or 9.04 ve
maybe the old kernel works, but the new doesnot
